posts.title: Jacques Lacan Speaks
posts.excerpt: Jacques Lacan (1901-1981) is widely regarded as one of the most influential psychoanalysts of the 20th century, one whose work has refashioned psychiatry both as a theory of the unconscious mind and as a clinical practice. His seminars and writings have also had a widespread influence throughout the humanities and social sciences, especially in education, …

posts._title: Aneta Leshnikovska – Boli li? Prvata balkanska dogma aka Does it hurt? (2007)
posts.title: Boli li? Prvata balkanska dogma
posts.excerpt: The Dogma 95 film movement appeared out of the need to make low budget films that will be concentrated on the storytelling and the acting. No long preparations, no stylish million-dollar bullshitting. Just film. For many years most of the filmmakers in the Balkan have been doing exactly the same. It is just that they …

posts._title: BBC – Human, All Too Human: Nietzsche, Heidegger, and Sartre (1999)
posts.title: Human, All Too Human: Nietzsche, Heidegger, and Sartre
posts.excerpt: BBC documentaries on 3 existentialist philosophers – Neitzsche, Heidegger and Satre. The rip quality is not great, but highly watchable and the standard of the documentaries is top notch featuring a number of highly respected academics plus Will Self.

posts.title: Killer of Sheep
posts.excerpt: The first feature film from acclaimed independent African American filmmaker Charles Burnett, this intensely emotional drama concerns a man who makes his living at a slaughterhouse as he struggles for economic and emotional survival and tries to patch up his often strained relationship with his family. Shot on weekends over a period of several years …

posts._title: Jerzy Kawalerowicz – Pociag AKA Night Train (1959)
posts.title: Pociag
posts.excerpt: Quote: Two strangers, Jerzy (Leon Niemczyk) and Marta (Lucyna Winnicka), accidentally end up holding tickets for the same sleeping chamber on an overnight train to the Baltic Sea coast. While handsome, well dressed and rather laconic, Jerzy seems ill at ease, while Marta is not talkative and would prefer to be alone. Staszek (Zbigniew Cybulski) …

posts._title: Jesus Franco – Eugenie AKA Eugenie Sex Happening (1974)
posts.title: Eugenie
posts.excerpt: the IMDB wrote: Eugenie, a beautiful but shy young girl, lives with her stepfather, a famous writer specializing in stories of erotica. One day she happens to read one of his “erotic” books and its power so affects her that begins to find herself sexually attracted to her stepfather. He notices this, and eventually brings …

posts._title: Gustav Wiklund – Exponerad aka Exposed aka The Depraved (1971)
posts.title: Exponerad
posts.excerpt: Quote: With periodic flashbacks and fantasy sequences, Exposed, in terms of its narrative structure at least, is a bit more complicated than your average sexploitation picture. While on the surface Lena is a typical, if flawed, central character the film lets us get into her head enough that even if we don’t completely see her …

posts._title: Hiroshi Teshigahara – Tanin no kao AKA The Face of Another (1966)
posts.title: Tanin no kao
posts.excerpt: Acquarello @ Strictly Film School wrote: An off-camera psychiatrist (Mikijiro Hira) overseeing a processed batch of prosthetic appendages describes his fragile role of diplomatically treating – not a patient’s physical imperfection – but rather, the psychological insecurity that underlies his seemingly superficial malady. The curious, fragmented shot of randomly floating, artificial body parts is subsequently …

posts._title: Sophie Fiennes – Pervert’s Guide to Ideology (2012)
posts.title: Pervert’s Guide to Ideology
posts.excerpt: Short Synopsis The makers of THE PERVERT’S GUIDE TO CINEMA return with THE PERVERT’S GUIDE TO IDEOLOGY. Philosopher Slavoj Zizek and filmmaker Sophie Fiennes use their interpretation of moving pictures to present a compelling cinematic journey into the heart of ideology – the dreams that shape our collective beliefs and practices.

posts._title: Alfred L. Werker – A-Haunting We Will Go (1942)
posts.title: A-Haunting We Will Go
posts.excerpt: Plot: The boys are recruited by a gang of thugs to get a coffin containing one of their far from dead colleagues to Dayton to try and get at an inheritance. After the coffin gets switched with the one Dante the Magician uses in his act, his stage show gets more than usually popular.
